c4p.brief: We are looking for speakers for GDG DevFest Glasgow
c4p.content:
We are looking for speakers for GDG DevFest Glasgow. Our focus is the content. **We’re looking for speakers like you**, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.  

Why is it cool to speak at the DevFest? You will get to interact with an incredible audience hungry to learn, network with others, enjoy the lovely city of Glasgow, and work on yourself. Our form is [available here](https://forms.gle/Mbec314M6Bk6PXZb7). If you would like to contact us for more information or submit a talk to discuss it, our email is [admin@gdg-glasgow.com](mailto:admin@gdg-glasgow.com).
c4p.title: We're looking for speakers

dfua19-announced.brief: It is official. GDG DevFest Glasgow 2019 is going to take place in Glasgow, on November 02.
dfua19-announced.content: It is official. GDG DevFest Glasgow 2019 is in motion. We do not have any details yet but will update this page as well as our social media once we confirm everything. Follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/gdgglasgow/) and join [Meetup](https://www.meetup.com/Glasgow-New-Technology-Meetup/) to keep up with announcements and conference updates.
dfua19-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Glasgow 2019

another-successful-devfest.brief: Thank you for making DevFest 2018 a success!
another-successful-devfest.content: Thank you for making our second DevFest a huge success. To the speakers and audience, you are all wonderful. Thank you for sharing in this moment with us. We hope to see you again.
another-successful-devfest.title: Another successful DevFest!

102.description: This session will be about Google Cloud Build. Audiences will be educated on what Cloud Build can do and how it helps increase the productivity of developers by providing an automated deployment pipeline as a code. Moreover, it will be told about the reasons for Cloud Build adoption, as well as the environment that Cloud Build may be fitted in. Furthermore, the instructions on how to use Cloud Build and integrate it with the existing GCP technologies will be demonstrated.
102.title: Google Cloud Build: What, Why and How.

103.description: OpenCue is a highly scalable open source render manager designed for the visual effects and animation industry. It provides a flexible architecture that allows you to tag and allocate jobs and tasks to specific machine types across multiple geographic locations, both on-premises and in the cloud. This talk will describe some of the highlight features of the open source project and demonstrate rendering an animation project in an OpenCue deployment running on Google Cloud Platform. The talk will also summarize the growing list of resources to help you learn more about OpenCue and deploy it in production.
103.title: Rendering film, TV, and games media on GCP with OpenCue

104.description:
This session will be about Machine learning while using SQL and also how you can extend it to Google Colab/JupyterLab notebooks on Google Cloud Platform for further analysis. 
Check out Google colab here: https://colab.research.google.com
104.title: Machine Learning at Scale with BigQuery

105.description: A small break to stretch about
105.title: Small Break

arut_jinadit.bio: Arut is currently a software engineering student at the School of Computing Science, University of Glasgow. On the other hand, he is also a freelance developer who works remotely from his home country. Most of his responsibilities are developing applications for both client-side and server-side. Arut is passionate about learning new technologies that could help increase his team members' productivity as well as sharing it with the community.
arut_jinadit.name: Arut Jinadit
arut_jinadit.shortBio: Arut is a software engineering student at the School of Computing Science, University of Glasgow
arut_jinadit.title: A freelance software developer and a student

sharif_salah.bio: Sharif is a senior technical writer at Google Cloud currently focusing on media and entertainment. Sharif is also a contributor to the open source OpenCue project for rendering visual effects and animation projects.
sharif_salah.name: Sharif Salah
sharif_salah.shortBio: Sharif is a senior technical writer at Google Cloud currently focusing on media and entertainment.
sharif_salah.title: Technical Writer, Google

polong_lin.bio: Polong is a Developer Advocate at Google, based in London, UK. He focuses on helping data scientists and data engineers leverage the cloud for machine learning & analytics. With a background in psychology, Polong particularly enjoys hearing about machine learning projects that intersect with human behaviour.
polong_lin.name: Polong Lin
polong_lin.shortBio: Polong is a Developer Advocate at Google, based in London, UK.
polong_lin.title: Developer Advocate, Data Science & Machine Learning

swav_kulinski.bio: Swav is a Flutter GDE (Google Developer Expert) and the lead of Android Community of Practice at The App Business which he has grown from start. For the last two years he have been promoting Flutter within the business and outside with his clients. Swav shares all his knowledge from commercial and non commercial development in blog posts. He strongly believe that Flutter has the massive potential to become a mainstream mobile app platform and will make the developer community better as it is more affordable and is quite a pleasure to learn.
swav_kulinski.name: Swav Kulinski
swav_kulinski.title: Flutter GDE, Lead Android Developer at The App Business

doug_sillars.bio:
Doug is a leading mobile performance developer advocate and evangelist. Doug has worked with thousands of developers around the world, helping them improve the speed, battery life and customer satisfaction of their mobile applications (both native and web). The author of O'Reilly's 'High Performance Android Apps,' he has spoken at conferences around the world on mobile performance.

He is currently freelancing, and traveling with his family of 6 (plus the dog!) as a digital nomad in Europe.
doug_sillars.name: Doug Sillars

2018.title: It's Time to Stop Stalling: Delivering Fast Video without the Buffering

doug_sillars.title: Freelance Performance Expert

amanda_cavallaro.bio: Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer and is passionate about Cloud technologies, Human Computer Interactions, and conversational apps. She works at resolver.co.uk and is a Women Techmakers Lead and Community Organiser at Google Developer Group Cloud London. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian and a little of Japanese.
amanda_cavallaro.name: Amanda Cavallaro

2018.title: Google Assistant: Interactions and Sentiments aiding Customers and Businesses

amanda_cavallaro.title: Co-Organizer GDG London

martin_hawksey.bio:
Martin has held advisory roles within the UK educational technology sector for a number of government-funded services. In these roles, he has supported staff in the exploration and adoption of innovative approaches to teaching and learning. Martin was also an early adopter of Google Apps Script and this tool regularly features in the solutions he publishes and often integrates with other Google products, such as Google Maps, Google Charts and Google Analytics.

As Chief Innovation, Technology and Community Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT) his work continues to focus on how Google services can be used to support the development of ALT's member community.
martin_hawksey.name: Martin Hawksey
martin_hawksey.title: GDE Google Apps Script and Chief Innovation, Technology and Community Officer at the Association for Learning Technology

natalia_tokarova.bio: Natalia Tokarova is a Site Reliability Engineer at Google.
natalia_tokarova.name: Natalia Tokarova
natalia_tokarova.title: SRE at Google

mel_vecerik.bio: Mel Vecerik is a research engineer at DeepMind.
mel_vecerik.name: Mel Vecerik
mel_vecerik.title: Research Engineer at Deepmind

rupert_whitehead.bio: Rupert Whitehead is a Developer Relations Regional lead at Google, responsible for the UK and Ireland. He is responsible for a number of programs including Google Developer Groups, Google Developer Experts, the Agencies Program, and more. His main focus is to help developers become more successful with Google’s technologies. Prior to Google, Rupert worked at Nokia and Symbian.
rupert_whitehead.name: Rupert Whitehead

2017.title: What's Google doing with Machine Learning?

rupert_whitehead.title: Developer Relations Regional Lead

augustin_zidek.bio: Augustin Žídek studied Computer Science at the University of Cambridge. After graduating, he joined DeepMind where he currently works as a Research Engineer. He enjoys playing musical instruments, hiking and fixing things.
augustin_zidek.name: Augustin Žídek
augustin_zidek.title: Research Engineer at Google DeepMind

jeff_dalton.bio: Jeff Dalton is a lecturer in Information Retrieval at the University of Glasgow. His current research focuses on information retrieval and natural language processing, in particular, conversational search and agent systems. Previously, he has worked at Google in the Machine Intelligence research group. His research there focused on relation extraction for knowledge graph completion, health knowledge discovery, and response ranking in the Google Assistant.
jeff_dalton.name: Jeff Dalton
jeff_dalton.title: Information Retrieval lecturer at the University of Glasgow
